title: Akari Nitta
personality: Akari is a kind and caring person but is quite serious when it comes to working. However, she does have limits to her tolerance as shown when she grew rather short-tempered when the First Years didn't answer their phones when she tried calling them. However, she does tend to show concern for others, such as when she made a cover-up about Yasohachi Bridge so that the female civilian who had its curse wouldn't panic.[1] She also didn't want Maki Zenin and Nobara Kugisaki to head off to break the veil right away, despite being accompanied by a Special Grade 1 Naobito.[2] Even though Haruta was after her, she asked Kugisaki to not push herself. Once she was rescued from the former by Nanami Even though she was badly injured, she made sure to ask him if Ijichi was still alive.[3]

title: Angel
abilities:
In their overall motif, the Angel and by extension Hana are based on the portrayal of angels in the Abrahamic religions, especially Christianity:
Hana is distinguished by her feathered wings and halo of light that she inherited from the Angel.
The Angel has described her personal creed as undoing that which "violates God's Law";[41] this reflects how angels, in the Abrahamic faiths, are believed to not only be God's messengers but also enforcers of his will on Earth.
The Angel's innate technique, which counters anything to do with curses, and her desire to kill Sukuna at all costs (the King of Curses who himself has a demonic motif) seem to reflect the essence of anti-demonic exorcism. Additionally, the Angel's epithet for Sukuna, "Disgraced One" (堕天, Daten?, lit. "Fallen One"), is most likely derived from the Japanese word for "Fallen Angel" (堕天使, Datenshi?).
The "Jacob's Ladder" technique is named after the ladder seen by the biblical patriarch Jacob in the Book of Genesis. The technique's use comes with a prayer-like chant, involves the creation of all-purifying light meant to "erase sin", and spawns a trumpet of light for Hana to sound (possibly based on the seven trumpets of Revelation), as well as cross-like shapes and small cherubic beings that fly around the target.
A particular scene where Hana saves a US soldier from a curse[42] is an obvious allusion to the famous fresco painting The Creation of Adam by Michelangelo.

personality: The Angel is a well-mannered, straightforward, and reasonable individual who seems to want what is best for the world at large. Since incarnating, she has made it her goal to wipe out all her fellow incarnated Culling Game players, as she deems them possessing humans and killing their egos in the process, whether intentionally or not, to "violate God's Law" (神の理に反する, Kami no Kotowari ni hansuru?); when Megumi asks for clarification, the Angel tells him that "God's Law" is merely her giving a name to her credo, implying that it is not meant to reflect a theistic outlook.[4] At the same time, while the Angel did strike a deal with the malefic Kenjaku for a chance to incarnate, she has since dedicated her time to actively opposing both him and Sukuna, the latter of whom the Angel calls "Disgraced One" (堕天, Daten?) and most strongly desires to kill.[5]

title: Garry K. Johnson

details.Kanji: ギャリー・K・ジョンソン

personality: Garry is a stereotypical muscle-headed American who believes in overwhelming might using guns and muscles. He is a career military man who requires clear and concise orders, even if they're unpleasant to recite. Garry is a proud American and has an ignorant nationalist mentality, constantly understating the merits of people from other countries and displaying blatant prejudice. He openly stated several stereotypes about Japanese people, claiming they're timid and pessimistic because they don't have guns and that they should stick to making cars and anime. This lead him to even underestimate jujutsu sorcerers, who he initially thought of as just psychics without any real training. Garry nearly sent a single company into the Culling Game before Kenjaku humbled him by displaying the full frightening force of jujutsu.[1]

personality: Haba is an aggressive and haughty man who likely played a cruel role in forcing Rin Amai to do Hanyu's bidding against his will. When Yuji took down Hanyu, Haba was upset and immediately attacked as any partner would be. Despite being defeated by Hiromi Higuruma, Haba heavily underestimated Yuji and arrogantly chose to ignore his aerodynamic advantage to attack at close range. When Yuji injured his hands breaking Haba's propellers, the latter was delirious from head trauma and arrogantly declared that Yuji lost because he broke his hand.[1][2]

personality: Kasumi is a kind hearted, hard-working girl who isn't as jaded as some of her classmates. She's much more restrained, down to earth, and behaves otherwise normally. Kasumi wants to be a sorcerer to make money and is a fan of Satoru Gojo. Despite being ordered to do so by the principal Yoshinobu Gakuganji, Kasumi was uncomfortable about her class' attempt on Yuji Itadori's life and apologizes for it later. The reason she tries so hard to succeed at Sorcery is that she wants to support her two younger brothers, showing her caring and steadfast attitude.

title: Kiyotaka Ijichi
abilities:
Kiyotaka's rankings in the Popularity Polls are as follows:
Kiyotaka ranked 23rd in the first Popularity Poll with 1,087 votes.
Kiyotaka ranked 29th in the second Popularity Poll with 188 votes.
Kiyotaka ranked 24th in the third Popularity Poll with 221 votes.
Kiyotaka ranked 23rd in the first Popularity Poll with 1,087 votes.
Kiyotaka ranked 29th in the second Popularity Poll with 188 votes.
Kiyotaka ranked 24th in the third Popularity Poll with 221 votes.

His surname has the Go-on reading for "Italy, that one" (伊, i?), "earth, ground" (地, ji?), and "to know, wisdom" (知, chi?). His given name has the kanji for "clean, pure" (潔, kiyo?) and the Kun reading for "tall, high" (高, taka?).

Kiyotaka is a self-proclaimed "fighter" but is not meant to be on the battlefield besides playing a supporting role.
At the time, he looked like he could fight, but in reality, the assistant manager didn't know how to fight and was technically forbidden from doing so. He handles simple barriers, supports jujutsu sorcerers with shikigami, and gives basic instruction to students who are new to field missions.

At the time, he looked like he could fight, but in reality, the assistant manager didn't know how to fight and was technically forbidden from doing so. He handles simple barriers, supports jujutsu sorcerers with shikigami, and gives basic instruction to students who are new to field missions.
He is excellent at desk work.
Sending students on dangerous missions, frequently getting into conflicts, being abused by Gojo and his other senior members- his heart can't take the stress much longer!
Kiyotaka was said to be the driver of Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical College and the assistant head in volume 0.
The theme songs that Gege chose for Kiyotaka is "Do Nacchaten Dayo" by Yasuyuki Okamura and "SPY" by Noriyuki Makihara.[5]

According to Jujutsu Kaisen Official Fanbook[1]:
His specialty is Excel.
Favorite food: Udon.
Least favorite food: Spicy food.
Cause of stress: Satoru Gojo.
His specialty is Excel.
Favorite food: Udon.
Least favorite food: Spicy food.
Cause of stress: Satoru Gojo.
personality: Kiyotaka is a relatively reserved person who tries their best to be professional. On the job, Kiyotaka confidently fills his role as head manager of Jujutsu High while working alongside students or other managers. However, he does have a tendency to get very nervous when things go awry. This especially applies to anything involving his friend Satoru Gojo. Satoru can end up belittling Kiyotaka from time to time, frustrating him.

Mahito (真人, Mahito?) is one of the primary antagonists of the Jujutsu Kaisen series. He is an unregistered special grade cursed spirit allied with Pseudo-Geto. He is also the leader of his own group, consisting of Jogo, Hanami, and Dagon. His group's ultimate goal is the eradication of humanity and ultimately replacing the population with cursed spirits.

Megumi Fushiguro Images

 


Megumi Fushiguro (伏黒恵, Fushiguro Megumi?) is the deuteragonist of the Jujutsu Kaisen series. He is a grade 2 jujutsu sorcerer and first-year student at Tokyo Jujutsu High alongside Yuji Itadori and Nobara Kugisaki. Megumi is the step-brother of Tsumiki Fushiguro and as the son of Toji Fushiguro, Megumi is also a descendant of the Zenin Clan. Megumi was born outside the clan as Toji's trump card and was eventually found by Satoru Gojo, who mentored him and enrolled him at Jujutsu High as his student.

title: Mei Mei
abilities: Night Parade of a Hundred Demons
personality: Mei Mei is a very calm and relaxed woman who can keep her cool in any situation. While very kind and honest, Mei Mei is very open about being greedy. Monetary value is the most important thing and quite possibly might be the only important thing to her. She considers herself to always be on the side of money and doesn't get out of bed for free. Allegiances and politics don't matter to Mei Mei as long as she gets paid for being a sorcerer. She also claims to not understand relationships not based on money.[1]

title: Misato Kuroi

details.Occupation: Jujutsu SorcererCaretaker of Star Plasma Vessel

abilities: Misato's surname contains the kanji for "black" (黒, kuro?) and "well, mine shaft, pit" (井, i?), and her first name contains "beautiful" (美, mi?) and "village" (里, sato?).
Misato looks young, so she's often asked if she is a student.[14]
The Kuroi family is part of a long line of aides to the Star Plasma Vessel. In defiance, Misato left for a junior college.[15]
She was planning on entering the civilian workforce but was drawn back into the life of an aide because of her fondness for Riko Amanai.[16]
Misato plays with Riko a lot at home and is super good at Mario Kart.[17]

Favorite food: Watermelon.

personality: Naobito is a tempered and aloof individual to a degree where it conflicts with his image as a clan head. Some question his capabilities as the head mainly due to his consistent drinking. Like the majority of the Zenin members, Naobito was raised on sorcerer traditionalist values thus crafting his personality into that of an arrogant person who dismisses any whose abilities he deems as beneath his, this extends even to his own family ergo his nieces. Naobito naturally clashes with Maki, who opposes him despite having little cursed energy. He threatened to get at Maki through her sister and has used his influence to keep her from being promoted.[3]

title: Noritoshi Kamo (Ancestor)
abilities: Noritoshi Kamo's name is pronounced the same way as his descendant, Noritoshi Kamo, but they are written differently.

His surname has the Kan-on and Go-on readings for "add, increase" (加, ka) and "overgrown, lush, thickly growing" (茂, mo), respectively. Meanwhile, his given name has the Kun reading for "constitution, basic law" (憲, nori) and "ethics" (倫, toshi).
It’s possible that Noritoshi Kamo had also inherited the Blood Manipulation Technique given that the Death Paintings had all inherited it or had variations of the technique.
personality: The original personality of Noritoshi Kamo is unknown due to his body having been stolen by Kenjaku. While inhabiting Noritoshi’s body, he gained a reputation as a cruel man, considered both a blot on the Kamo Family and the evilest jujutsu sorcerer to have ever lived. His experiments during the Meiji Era were so vile, all records were destroyed and even the curses that resulted from them, despite having no hatred for humanity, despised him.

title: Rika Orimoto
abilities: Rika's surname contains the kanji for "prayer" (祈, ori?) and "origin, base" (本, moto?), and her first name contains "village, hometown, one's past" (里, ri?) and "fragrance" (香, ka?).

According to Volume 0[1]:
Rika's mother died suddenly when she was five from unknown causes.
Two days before Rika went to elementary school, Rika and her father got lost while mountain climbing. A week later Rika was found alone and rescued by a shelter near the summit.
While at the hospital she met Yuta who was being treated for pneumonia.
Her father was never found and his death was never confirmed.
Aware of how her appearance is perceived, Rika sometimes manipulates adults.
Rika's grandmother from her father's side took her in. She strongly believed Rika killed both her parents.
Rika stole the ring she gave to Yuta from her grandmother's dresser. It was her mother's wedding ring.
When she was human, Rika was very friendly with Yuta's younger sister. However, after becoming a vengeful curse, she became aggressive, which is why Yuta distanced himself from his family.
She dislikes everyone besides Yuta- especially girls and older guys.
The thing she dislikes the most in the world is her grandmother's stewed eggplant.
She loves Yuta.

personality: Rika was an innocent young girl and childhood friend of Yuta. She shared a special connection with Yuta and believed that she loved him. These feelings lingered on even after her death. As a vengeful spirit, Rika desired only to protect Yuta, but her great power often caused her to harm others in the process. While she had curse-like instincts to attack anything that was a threat, Rika still listened to Yuta and restrained herself because of her love for him.

personality: Suguru Geto hated non-sorcerers, usually referring to them as "monkeys". He felt sorcerers are the superior race and humanity's next stage of evolution. He was smug and extremely condescending towards normal humans, using fake personas to lure in vulnerable people who were cursed. Suguru found non-sorcerers disgusting enough to spray himself in order to disinfect the "monkey stench". He believed monkeys only have two roles in association with him, money-collecting monkeys and curse-collecting monkeys. If they weren't fulfilling their roles, Suguru would gladly allow curses to kill them without any remorse.[4]

title: Takeru
personality: Takeru is a caring and cheerful cursed corpse who cares deeply for his creator: Masamichi Yaga, with who he seems to have a paternal relationship, as he wanted the rest of the cursed corpses to cheer him up upon seeing him down. He was shown to think of himself as someone intelligent and perceptive, as he proudly asks people about being a genius with a big smile. Given his mother's depression after his death and tears of joy upon being reunited with his cursed corpse, it can be assumed Takeru was a loving son who shared a deep connection with her, which is proved by Atsuya's statement that she couldn't live without his support.

Toge Inumaki Images

 


Toge Inumaki (狗巻棘, Inumaki Toge?) is a major supporting character in Jujutsu Kaisen and one of the main protagonists of its prequel, Jujutsu Kaisen 0: Jujutsu High. He is a descendant of the Inumaki clan and has inherited the clan's cursed speech, which he's developed his own unique speech pattern for in order to avoid cursing others. Toge is currently a semi-grade 1 jujutsu sorcerer and second-year at Tokyo Jujutsu High alongside his classmates Yuta, Maki, and Panda.

abilities: His surname has the Go-on reading for "shrine, mausoleum" (祢, ne) and the rendaku pronunciation of the Kun reading of "tree, wood" (木, ki). Altogether, his name can also be read as "spring onion" (葱, negi).
His given name has the Kun reading for "profit, benefit" (利, toshi) and the Nanori reading of "long time" (久, hisa).
personality: Little is known about Negi, but he clearly shares Suguru Geto's vision to eradicate non-sorcerers. He refers to normal humans as monkeys and wants them all to suffer so the strong will thrive while curses fade from existence for good. He would prefer not to kill jujutsu sorcerers in battle but will attack if necessary.

title: Yu Haibara
abilities:
Yu's rankings in the Popularity Polls are as follows:
Yu ranked 26th in the second Popularity Poll with 266 votes.
Yu ranked 26th in the third Popularity Poll with 189 votes.
Yu ranked 26th in the second Popularity Poll with 266 votes.
Yu ranked 26th in the third Popularity Poll with 189 votes.
Yu's surname contains the kanji for "ashes" (灰, hai?) and "meadow" (原, bara?), and his first name contains "masculine/excellence" (雄, yū?).
Yu likes girls who eat a lot.[3]
Yu doesn't come from a family of jujutsu sorcerers, but he does have a younger sister who can see curses.[2]
Yu sternly forbid his sister from going to Jujutsu High.[2]
Yu likes rice and people.[2]

According to Jujutsu Kaisen Official Fanbook[1]:
His hobby is hearty eating.
Favorite dish: Rice.
Least favorite dish: None.
Cause of stress: None.
If he was alive, he would think that Geto's betrayal was unbelievable.
He respects Geto and Gojo because he only saw the good things that people did, he respected everyone the same.
Him and Nanami got along pretty well. They were the only second-years at the time, so after Yu passed, Nanami was alone.

personality: Yu was an optimistic and cheerful young man who was willing to prove himself to his upperclassmen. Regarding himself as a simple person who doesn't think too hard on things, he found pride and joy from being a jujutsu sorcerer as it was something he could do. He also considered himself a good judge of character.

personality: Yuji is a fair person who truly cares for not only his comrades but anyone he views as people with their own wills, despite how deep or shallow his connection to them is. He highly commends "the value of life," and to this end, he will ensure that others receive a "proper death". Because of this, he believes that it is morally unethical for him to take another human life, and tries to avoid any possibility of doing so unless as a last resort.

Jujutsu Kaisen: Hidden Inventory • Premature Death / Shibuya Incident Original Soundtrack (「呪術廻戦 懐玉・玉折 / 渋谷事変」オリジナル・サウンドトラック, Jujutsu Kaisen Kaigyoku • Gyokusetsu / Shibuya Jihen Orijinaru Saundotorakku?) is the official soundtrack of season 2 of the anime adaptation, covering the Gojo's Past Arc and the Shibuya Incident Arc. It was composed by Yoshimasa Terui, including a vocal performance by Tomoyo Kurosawa.
